oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Crop Reports for Knox County
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Agriculture; Crop yields; Livestock; Agricultural laborers; Crop losses
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: These 1886 Average Crop Reports chart the county-by-county acreage, yield, condition, and damage of specific crops and livestock by local Tennessee farmers from April through November and offer them in comparision to the 1885 reports as an average. The wages of farm hands are also treated.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Department of Agriculture
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Record Group 15, Department of Agriculture Records
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: From the 1871 creation of the Bureau of Agriculture, the first incarnation of the Department of Agriculture, the gathering and publication of crop reports have been a primary responsibility of this entity. These county-by-county statistics have allowed for the evaluation of the State's agricultural capacity and potential.
